===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いなずま|稲|tr1=ina|t1=rice plant|pos1=ancient bound-form reading of modern ''ine''|妻|tr2=tsuma|t2=wife, spouse}} or {{m|ja|夫|tr=tsuma||husband, spouse}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>  {{rendaku2|sort=いなずま|tsuma|zuma}}

A belief in ancient times was that rice plants would mate with or otherwise be fertilized by lightning,<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> a frequent occurrence in the late summer and autumn when rice plants come to fruition.<ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>
